conclusion: Analyze the path of the light beam through the prism using angles and properties of reflection and refraction.
Identify angles: angle A = 90 degrees, angle B = 60 degrees, angle C = 30 degrees.
Path of light: starts at D on BC, reflects at E on AC, total internal reflection at F on AB, exits prism.
Angle of incidence at E is 30 degrees, angle of reflection is also 30 degrees.
Total internal reflection at F means angle of incidence at F is greater than critical angle; angle of incidence at F is 60 degrees.
Angle of deviation is the angle between the incident ray and the emergent ray.
Incident ray makes 30 degrees with normal at D, emergent ray makes 60 degrees with normal at F.
Total deviation angle is sum of angles of incidence and reflection: 30 degrees + 60 degrees = 90 degrees.
Final angle of deviation of the incident light relative to point D is 60 degrees.
